intro: Lycopersicon pyriforme, commonly known as the wild tomato, is a species native to South America. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into orange-red fruits resembling small tomatoes. Its botanical features include a taproot system and opposite leaf arrangement. Lycopersicon pyriforme is often studied for its genetic relationship to cultivated tomatoes.
